meanings.definition: To surpass in blooming or flowering.
meanings.sent1: The rose outbloomed all the other flowers in the garden.
meanings.sent2: Her garden always looks beautiful because her flowers outbloomed the rest.
meanings.sent3: The tulip outbloomed the daisy, making it jealous.
meanings.sent4: The cherry blossoms outbloomed the competition, painting the town pink.
meanings.sent5: The sunflower outbloomed its neighbors, standing tall and proud.

meanings.definition: To bloom more than something else.
meanings.sent1: The daffodil outbloomed the tulip this year.
meanings.sent2: In spring, the cherry blossoms always outbloomed the other trees.
meanings.sent3: The rose outbloomed the daisy, showing off its vibrant colors.
meanings.sent4: Her talent for gardening outbloomed everyone else's, making her the neighborhood expert.
meanings.sent5: The lily outbloomed the competition, stealing the spotlight in the garden.
